column1: #Text=Nauru raises media visa application fee from AU$ 200 to $ 8,000
#Text=Image : Department of Immigration and Citizenship ( DIAC ) .
#Text=The cabinet of the island nation of Nauru endorsed rise of the cost of an application for single-entry three-month media visa from AU $ 200 to $ 8,000 last Thursday .

#Text=The rise followed a scandal last weekend involving 60 Lebanese asylum seekers voluntarily deciding to return home from the Nauru offshore processing facility , an Australian immigration detention facility , after facing harsh physical conditions and disorientation .

#Text=Nauru 's Government Information Office Director Joanna Olsson appeared to be unaware that the new visa fee had yet to take effect , writing an email to a visa applicant about the new fee last Tuesday : " Sorry for the late response but yes we are granting media visas .

column3:
_	_	_	_

#Text=She also claimed the new fee had been implemented  a couple [ of ] months ago " , The Sydney Morning Herald reported .

column1: #Text=On the contrary , on Thursday during a meeting , Nauru 's Principal Immigration Officer Ernest Stephen said the price change was " not official " and the price rise had not yet passed into law through the Parliament .
#Text=Stephen said only three or four Nauru media visas were granted last year .
#Text=A member of Nauru Opposition Group , Mathew Batsiua , claimed the move was an oppression of journalistic freedom .

#Text=" They [ the Nauru authorities ] certainly bully our local media in terms of what they can show , who they can interview , and this is another illustration of that kind of behaviour in terms of bullying media and avoiding accountability .

#Text=... This hiking up of fees for journalists coming in to Nauru is a step in that direction , and we think that it 's the wrong move and we 're certainly opposing it .

_	_	_	_

#Text=The rise of the visa fee followed a recent scandal involving the majority of 60 Lebanese asylum seekers , targeted by people smugglers , deciding to return home from the Nauru and neighbouring Manus Island detention centres after a discussion with Australian government adviser Jamal Rifi on the weekend of January 4 .
